metadata.title: CVE-2022-1865 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in Bookmarks in Google Chrome prior to 102.0.5005.61 allowedan attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension topotentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted Chrome Extension andspecific user interaction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1865` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '103.0.5060.134-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
